values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Looks like these modules are still being used, at least indirectly. This requires a thorough change in my opinion. Also it looks like some of it is being done in Zhi's patch here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127923/

Patch Set 1:

Your opinion is wrong, dependency are picked automatically by oslo-incubator script. So this is a mistake and a correct patch.

Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I consider Hemanth's concerns is reasonable, but if I miss anything please let me know.

Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 2:

Guys, I'm very sorry that you are Glance reviewers and that you have no clue how the oslo-incubator works, but this patch is correct, I'm really sorry.

Go read the update.py script if you do not trust me (FWIW I'm an oslo-core member).

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo-incubator/tree/update.py

Patch Set 2:

Thanks for linking us to the code, I'll take a look at it. 

I'd like you to understand that its not about trust. I'll admit that I may be unfamiliar with some oslo stuff but let's keep away from hurling pleasantries at each other. This is a professional forum and it's best to keep it that way. Thanks for your good work with Oslo being a core member. That's actually a really good reason you should educate an ignorant one like me :)

Patch Set 2:

Actually I think this is not a technical question here, it depends on how did we define openstack-common.conf. With some talks in IRC, I still think update.py couldn't do all works for us, for example [0], it couldn't maintain imported module files and update config file automatically, and IMO list all the imported modules in openstack-common.conf explicitly could make it more clear. So, I think if we always need to check and update config file by hand why we don't make config file be more clear?

If I miss anything please let me know.

[0] When I do

  $ ./update.sh --nodeps --base glance --dest-dir ../glance --modules policy

even the latest policy.py doesn't use "strutils.py" as a dependency, strutils.py would be removed still, and the related record are still in openstack-common.conf as well: "module=strutils".

Thanks,
zhiyan

Patch Set 2:

Btw, regarding to you mentioned process, it cannot be ruled out the update.py need to be enhanced or see it as a defect.

Patch Set 2:

Hemanth, I agree with you and I meant no offense. But if you review patch and vote with -1, you HAVE to be pretty confident about your decision and knowledgeable on the subject. In this case, it seems to me that you are not.

I wish I could build a seminar to explain to you how all this work, but for now the more I can do is to point you at the update.py file. :)

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Guys, the patch is correct!

update.py will pick the dependencies automatically and it is *NOT* recommended to use `--nodeps` unless you *really* know what you're doing.

Please, lets ease the steps towards a `non-copy` based consumption of oslo modules.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As Flavio and Julien said, update.py will handle dependencies automatically. It's important for the Oslo team to be able to tell which modules are actually used in a project, rather than used indirectly, so we can help with project updates and find potential API issues as incubated modules change. Including extra modules in the config file for update.py makes our jobs a little harder.

Patch Set 2:

When I do "$ ./update.sh --base glance --dest-dir ../glance --modules policy" (without "--nodeps" flag) even the latest policy.py doesn't use "strutils.py" as a dependency any more, in-tree strutils.py would _not_ be removed and the related record are still in openstack-common.conf as well - "module=strutils".

So I consider "update.py will handle dependencies automatically" is not true for now, it could do import/copy work but inverse, so even we are going to go update.py way to maintain dependency automatically, we will still need to do some enhancements on it, e.g. for this case, better result is the "strutils.py" should be removed from the tree and openstack-common.conf get updated, IMO, finally we still need to handle dependencies manually - check copied files in openstac/common dir, delete file from tree and update conf file.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This looks kosher, let's land it.

Cheers,
Eoghan
